newsitem.title: INDIA: INDIAN HEADLINE STOCKS-Factors to watch - April 7.
newsitem.headline: INDIAN HEADLINE STOCKS-Factors to watch - April 7.

text.p: Following are some of the main factors affecting Indian stock markets on Monday morning:
** Indian stocks are expected to stay jittery this week as players shy away from building positions with the fate of the federal government unknown, brokers say
** Political crisis deepens after Hindu nationalists, rebellious Congress both pledge to bring down Prime Minister Deve Gowda's government in looming trust vote

** The ruling United Front coalition and its rival, the Congress party, remain at loggerheads ahead of a parliamentary confidence vote this week that will determine whether the 15-party government stands or falls

** "I do not have any grudge against the United Front, but this man -- the prime minister -- is not only inefficient but communal," Congress President Sitaram Kesri tells supporters at a rally on the weekend
** Indian truckers, whose countrywide strike has paralysed trade and pushed up prices, press their campaign against a new tax

** Palestinian President Yasser Arafat arrives in the Indian capital for a meeting of the Non-Aligned Movement (NAM) and is due to address NAM foreign ministers later today in a special plenary session
** A recent flip-flop in the aviation policy barring foreign airlines from taking stakes in the domestic sector sends worrisome signals about the pace of economic reform, analysts say.
** Largest aluminium maker NALCO says it raises prices of all grades of aluminium by 5,300 rupees per tonne
** Largest commercial bank the State Bank of India will announce its 1996/97 (April-March) results on June 19
** Software firm Infosys Technologies due to meet for bonus share issue and results on Tuesday

** Ispat Industries Ltd's planned eight billion rupees ($223 million) rights issue will go ahead at the end of April despite the political uncertainties plaguing the country's stock markets, the firm's finance director says in a newspaper interview published on Sunday
** Bombay's benchmark 30-share index .BSESN ends 9.28 points, or 0.26 percent, down at 3550.37 in range-bound trade on Friday
** Delhi index drops 2.33 points to 747.69, Madras falls 6.52 pts to 3433.39, National exchange .NSEI down 9.65 pts at 1,001.0
** Indian rupee INR= opens at 35.865/875 per dollar against Friday's close of 35.87/88
